issue.title: docker volume plugin restoreState: skip fs option if empty - fixes #6769

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the purpose of this change?

Upon remount an empty fs option leeds to a parsing error and thus does not recreate the volume after docker restart

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

rclone volume plugin does not remount crypt volume on docker restart #6769

I have checked that in case the fs option is passed, the value must be != ""

#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-new-feature-or-bug-fix).
- [n/a] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [n/a] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

body: I think it was as easy as testing for non-empty. In my opinion this should always work, not only on crypted remotes.
Nice work as someone should take a look at the PR and comment there as that's beyond my skillset :)
out of curiosity: who and when would look at the PR?
@logopk sorry - fell off my list. your PR looks great - will merge provided the CI passes - thank you

issue.title: Docker volume lost after reboot

repository.name: plex_debrid
repository.description: Plex torrent streaming through Debrid Services

issue.body:
I created the volume using official method mentioned in the step by step installation page on GitHub

docker plugin install itstoggle/docker-volume-rclone_rd:amd64 args="-v" --alias rclone --grant-all-permissions config=~/rclone/config cache=~/rclone/cache

Then

docker volume create realdebrid -d rclone -o type=realdebrid -o realdebrid-api_key=your-api-key-here -o allow-other=true -o dir-cache-time=10s

And mounted the volume with the containers i like eg. Plex, jellyfin etc

What happen is when reboot the server. Those containers mapped with realdebrid volume not able to start. It throws an error. When i checked the logs of the container. I found out that those containers not able to mount the volume realdebrid

When i list available volumes using docker command, I can't find the volume, so I will run this command

docker volume create realdebrid -d rclone -o type=realdebrid -o realdebrid-api_key=your-api-key-here -o allow-other=true -o dir-cache-time=10s

And the start the containers again. Then everything works perfectly..

This happens every time I reboot.... Any solution???

body:
I just wanted to say, this is probably only partly fixed. 
Using the options type and path instead of only remote doesn't save fs in docker-plugin.state (although path is saved). This will lead to rclone mounting the base directory of the backend instead of a subdirectory (or in my case the s3 bucket specified with the path option). I guess it uses fs instead of path to remount a backend.
If not fixed, your best bet would be to open up a new issue with all the details.
